page.title: 02Vale View Farm
page.content: The farm which is 130 acres overlooks the Vale of Belvoir. The farm is mainly grassland and the main product is milk. The herd of 50 cows is milked twice a day and the milk goes to Nottingham each morning.The farm work is done by Mr. and Mrs.Hyslop and their son Mark.The day starts at 5.30am.The milking starts at 6am. and ends at 8am. when they have breakfast. After this the calves are fed. They keep most of the 50 calves born each year. Some will replace the cows in the herd and the rest are kept to produce meat.Mrs. Hyslop feeds the calves twice a day on a milk mixed with warm water.After 6 weeks the calves are taken off milk and given calf feed.
